questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
As a Customer Data Platform Specialist, you set up audience insights as the new Customer Data Platform.
The product owner wants you to make sure that data sources are refreshed daily.
Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.A: Data source credentials can be copied from an existing environment to a new production environment.
choices.B: You must log out of one environment to access new environments that are on the same tenant.
choices.D: You can select the Environment control in the upper-right corner of the page to change environments.
choices.C: When you create a new production environment, you can choose to copy the configuration from an existing environment.

questions.question_text:
You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. You already have a few existing production environments for audience insights. You were given a new production environment.
Which two statements are correct about creating a new production environment when other environments already exist? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. You are reviewing the system status. You notice that an insights refresh process shows a `skipped` status.
Which system process type should you review to find the step that is blocking the insights refresh from starting?

discussion.content: Insights Runs manually (single time refresh). Depends on segments.

questions.question_text:
You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. You are implementing a scheduled refresh in audience insights.
Which two statements are correct when describing scheduled refreshes? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.A: To exclude a segment from a scheduled refresh, you must deactivate it before the scheduled refresh run.
choices.C: The refresh schedule can be applied to selected data sources or specific entities within these data sources.
choices.B: Scheduled refresh is not available in trial environments and can only be configured for production instances.
choices.D: When you configure a refresh schedule to run daily, you must define the time zone and time when the refresh needs to run.

comments.content: Incorrect. I've scheduled refreshes in trial environments before. AD is the correct answer.

discussion.content: Scheduled refresh is not supported in sandbox and trial environments -> it should be B instead of A.

questions.question_text:
Your company wants to create a trial instance of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights before committing to a production environment.

You need to set up the trial environment.

What is a clear difference between setting up a trial and production environment with Dynamics 365 Customer Insights?

discussion.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/data/trial-faq

B is correct.

"
- You can't use your own Azure Data Lake Storage account to store output data during a trial of Customer Insights. However, you can ingest data from a Data Lake Storage account.
- You can store a up to 3 GB of data in the Dataverse environment that gets provisioned automatically when you start a Customer Insights trial.
"

choices.D: You can only configure access to a single user when using a trial environment.
choices.B: You can only use your own Azure Data Lake storage account to store output data when using a production environment.
choices.A: You can only ingest data from a Data Lake storage account when using a production environment.
choices.C: You can only connect to trials of Dynamics 365 apps such as Sales, Marketing, and Customer Service when using a trial environment.
